Message.Title: Golfer (Gopher) in Chief!
Message.Msg: Yep, and right after the meaningless photo-op speech off to the Floridian @ cost of $180000 to "learn" golf from the biggest pro trainer. His limo was shipped by the air force because he needs a motorcade, he is just so important, the pompous, tax payers money spending King Obimbo! (It's been just such a long time after their Hawaiian vacation, they must be exhausted - from spending) Time for the IDIOT to go! (One way or another!) ROWDY

Message.Title: Two billion spent on illegal immigrant baby deliveries
Message.Msg: **The vast majority of the total emergency care reimbursements cover delivering babies** Yep, that's what we need more of poor and uneducated women having more babies to educate(at least to the 10th grade when most drop out), healthcare, welfare, HUD, Foodstamps, incarcerate cost, etc. Yet, they pay nothing toward their healthcare while all along sending billions back to their home countries. Vincent Fox was a genius, he closed the boarder to his south, and opened the boarder to his north to rid himself of his poor and potencial political trouble makers...kind of like the keystone pipeline for illegals from Mexico to the USA.... Are we collectively as a nation this stupid? Report: $2 billion spent annually for Medicaid emergencies, largely for illegal immigrant baby deliveries Even though federal law largely bars illegal immigrants from obtaining Medicaid coverage, the program annually pays out more than $2 billion in free emergency coverage that mostly goes to illegal immigrants, according to Kaiser Health News. The vast majority of the total emergency care reimbursements cover delivering babies, Kaiser reports. Based on a Kaiser data analysis of the states believed to have the greatest populations of illegal immigrants —including California, New York, Texas, North Carolina, Arizona, Illinois and Florida — more than 100,000 people annually receive emergency care that is reimbursed by Medicaid. California, Kaiser’s analysis showed, receives approximately half of the annual $2 billion Medicaid expenditure category.

What's to say? Aside from a potential surprise announcement (unlikely, financials are mostly boring), we're just waiting for next quarters earnings to see how the strategic picture has changed. I'm leary of saying a strong buy at this level unless you have no position at all, but I wouldn't take all my position at once here. I'd rather chance averaging up my allotted ETFC investment than diving in all at once and then seeing it drop to $9 range for another 3 months. I've got a decent position in this stock already so for me it's just a buy, for now. However I have other Strong Buy's (which this was) still under-invested, so I imagine I'm just sitting on my position for now.
Why not go swap spit wif the prescient prognosticator who posted recently calling for a fifty-bagger in the near future?
